title.narrative: DRR AND EMERGENCY IN EDUCATION

description.narrative: Education system is strengthened for DRR and emergency response, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Skills Development, Skills Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased percentage of vulnerable children and adolescents participating in relevant, quality and inclusive pre-university education with improved learning outcomes and competences

participating-org.narrative: ZAVOD ZA UNAPREDJIVANJE OBRAZOVANJA I VASPITANJA
ZAVOD ZA VREDNOVANJE KVALITETA OBRAZOVANJA I VASPITANJA

sector.narrative: Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education system is strengthened for DRR and emergency response

description.narrative: UNICEF supported national efforts to ensure and monitor the continuation of learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, supporting teachers to gain digital literacy skills and providing support with the focus on to the most vulnerable children. As a result, the coverage with distance learning was high, the position of children from vulnerable groups was monitored, resilience of the education system was strengthened, while initial efforts were made to enable the education system to address the growing digital divide and to further develop online and blended learning modalities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2020
